question: In the following equation representing decay, the number of neutrons in the nucleus X is <katex>${}_{83}^{210}Bi\rightarrow X+e^{-1}+\overline{V}$</katex>
explanation: In beta decay (<katex>$e^-$</katex>), the atomic number Z increases by 1, mass number A remains same. <katex>$X$</katex> will be <katex>${}_{84}^{210}Po$</katex>. Number of neutrons <katex>$N = A - Z = 210 - 84 = 126$</katex>.
